name: Harriet's Rooftop
address: 60 Furman St Floor 11, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA

reviews.text: The minimum is $150 per person- we thought it was per reservation- view is stunning and food and drinks are good but plan to spend a lot.

Josh is an amazing bartender! Heâ€™s friendly, attentive, and makes every guest feel welcome. His drink recommendations are always on point, and he mixes cocktails perfectly every time. You can tell he genuinely enjoys what he doesâ€”great energy, great service, and always a good time when Josh is behind the bar.
Te cobran el mÃ¡s alto en propina aÃºn consumas solo 3 bebidas

My very favorite rooftop in New York! ğŸ™ŒğŸ½
Stunning view, great drinks and food!
Thanks to the crew for taking care of us!!!
I highly recommendâ€¦ specially for the sunset ğŸ‘ŒğŸ½
Donâ€™t forget to make the reservation in advance.
Awesome drinks, awesome views ğŸ’—- Ely âœ¨makes the best espresso martini ğŸ¸ and makes you feel welcome // definitely coming back
Expensive but it offers the best views in town! Food and drinks are amazing, well worth the price! â¤ï¸
The atmosphere and view was amazing. Food delicious. Staff was so professional and kind. The manage Rayon was lovely and kept checking in to make sure we were okay and taken care of.
Wonderful view of the Manhattan skyline and Brooklyn Bridge. Plus exceptional service from our bartender, Josh!  Try the spicy tuna roll. ğŸ‘
Bartenders need an attitude check.

Extremely disappointing experience at Harrietâ€™s Rooftop Bar.
My husband and I waited at the bar for more than 15 minutes, but 2 white male bartenders kept serving others who arrived after us.
They deliberately avoided making eye contact with us the entire time, even though we were standing right in front of them.
The bartender with middle-parted brown hair was particularly dismissive.
Only after I took out my phone to record did they suddenly acknowledge us.
It was an obvious case of selective ignoring, and it made us feel extremely uncomfortable and disrespected.
Very poor and unprofessional service.
Alvin the host was truly phenomenal, so kind and so NY I loved it. Made my visit so welcoming
It is on 11th floor. I visit this rooftop every time Iâ€™m in New York. Love it.
The view canâ€™t be beat and the food was delicious. Our server, Marto, was wonderful and attentive.
The food was amazing and the service was impeccable. When you come in, make sure to ask for Marto. He will make sure you have an amazing experience. 10/10 ğŸ˜Š

Posto strepitoso con la miglior vista sullo skyline di Manhattan. Sono stato a cena con mia moglie per il suo compleanno e il buon Trey ci ha coccolati col suo ottimo servizio. Consiglio a tutti se passate da New York per una bella cena romantica

It is a beautiful spot. But they overcharged my card, (they also made the drinks with cheaper tequila than they specify on the menu) so when I called for them to fix it, they made me give them my entire CC info but they never refunded me.
Soooooooooooo worth it for the view but the vibes and the food and service makes it even more elavated of an experience. Marto made us feel so special!

Food was pretty good but donâ€™t get the wagyu. Chewy and not worth the price. Service was fast but it wasnâ€™t crowded at all. Views are amazing and the space is nice. Drinks were so good. $75 min spend per person but not hard to reach lol

Just overall an annoying process. The whole reservation situation, the inability to explain the costs associated to each type of reservation, the cost to get into a bland rooftop bar with music that was so loud you couldnâ€™t even talk to people at your table.

Plenty of better options. The view is just as nice from the ground.

While the venue itself is undeniably stunning, the overall experience was disappointing due to the lack of professionalism and hospitality from the staff. From the moment we arrived, it felt as though the level of attention depended on how much one was willing to spend.

The hostess informed us of a minimum spend per person, which we understood, but her manner of redirecting us to the bar after we mentioned we were only there for drinks came across as dismissive and unwelcoming. Unfortunately, that tone continued at the bar, where the bartender showed little enthusiasm or courtesy.

For the prices they charge, the drinks were underwhelming and did not reflect the quality one would expect from a place of this caliber. The only redeeming feature was the view: breathtaking, but not enough to make up for the poor service.

Overall, itâ€™s a beautiful setting overshadowed by an uninviting atmosphere. I wouldnâ€™t return, nor would I recommend it unless significant improvements are made to the service and hospitality.
The worst experience ever, 25 minutes for a beer.

We zaten rustig een veel te dure cocktail te drinken toen we werden weggejaagd door een ober genaamd Marocco. Erg onbeleefd en duidelijk geen flauw idee hoe hij respectvol met klanten moet omgaan. We konden maar elders plaatsnemen zei hij, maar hij had 'nu' de bank nodig. Hoewel er nergens anders plaats was, werden we weggestuurd en moesten we maar rechtstaan. Toen we zijn baas erbij vroegen, was ook hij onbeschoft en lachte ons uit.
Lekkere cocktails, mooi uitzicht, maar niet waard om ernaartoe te gaan. Veel andere en betere plekken met een even mooi uitzicht!
Good drinks but service And Barman really unpleasantâ€¦ And online we can clearly see foods on the rooftop or we were Said no Food serviceâ€¦ disappointed

I had such a memorable time at Harrietâ€™s Lounge in Brooklyn! The vibe was absolutely perfect â€” stylish, relaxing, and full of good energy. The atmosphere made it a great spot to unwind, and the view added an extra touch of magic to the evening.

The cocktails were creative and delicious, and the food matched the high standard of the lounge. The service was excellent too â€” attentive, friendly, and professional, which made the experience even better.

Harrietâ€™s Lounge is definitely a place Iâ€™d recommend for anyone looking to enjoy a great night out in Brooklyn. Iâ€™ll definitely be back!

Harriet's Rooftop is simply gorgeous, with an impecable staff with character, and great scenic vibes to match. I had the Mushroom Bao after being convinced to try it, although I don't like mushrooms. It was delicious!! Thoroughly impressed, and will definitely be coming back! :)

The is place was soooooo lit!!! Trey, Isaiah, Aubrey, Andre (security) were all so great, very welcoming. They complimented us and were very helpful. Had a great time with great people and great vibes! Everybody was so polite and delightful, will recommend to anybody whenever they visit New York! :)

Toller Standort mit grandioser Aussicht. Das Personal/Service ist leider nur Durchschnitt. In der Bar unter dem Rooftop roch es  sehr stark nach Chlor und machte leider auch keinen wirklich guten Eindruck.
The views are stunning and the hostess was very nice. We were just there for drinks and some appetizers.

Booked a month in advance, gave my card details, and even confirmed the day before. They cancelled my reservation just because I didnâ€™t re-enter my card one hour before (while sightseeing!) and still charged me $50. I emailed them to dispute this but never got a reply. Completely unreasonable and unprofessional..
Thanks Marto!

Very disappointing experience. The restaurant was extremely busy, but no one came to our table to take the order. Service was very slow and unorganized. We waited a long time without any attention, and finally left because no one served us. Definitely not a good experience.

My advise, donâ€™t go there
La vue est incroyable, super ambiance, personnel sympathique Ã  ne pas rater !

The view was beautiful but only second to the service which was exceptional. Marto my server was personable and professional
Order the Wagyu Slidersâ€¦ trust me

We had breakfast at Harrietâ€™s Rooftop at 1 Hotel Brooklyn Bridge, and it was nothing short of impeccable. The view alone is breathtaking â€“ truly one of a kind. The food was absolutely delicious, and the service left nothing to be desired. Our waiter, Marto, was exceptionally kind and attentive, making the whole experience feel even more special. A perfect spot for both the palate and the soul!

OMG
The service was second to none. I believe it was CoCo our waitress that made our experience fantastic. Luis was amazing very knowledgeable and quick to suggest what I may be in a mood for. Cocktails were delicious.
Im coming back

Came to Harrietâ€™s lounge for a quick drink and wind up staying and enjoying dinner coco took care of me and my family and she made our night special. The manager Luis suggested the chicken Goyoza and I wind up ordering two. The staff was so welcoming. I canâ€™t wait to come back.

My wife and I had our anniversary dinner here. The place was perfect all around. The ambience, the view (spectacular), food, and all the service was A1. Our server Kyle M. was very friendly and easy to talk to. He also gave us great recommendations. Kyle M. always checked up on us to see if everything was fine. You guys need to hire more people like Kyle. Super attentive and a people's person for sure thanks again Kyle and the rest that helped that night. Cheers!
We went to a rooftop party here which was great fun. The drinks are WILDLY expensive, but the view is unparalleled.
Monumental views, decent appetizers, not-so-bad drinks! Pricey but well you are paying for the views (and experience) too. Definitely worth a visit!
No wonder this has a low rating. Made an accidental booking, called immediately after it went through and they refused to cancel without charging a fee. Shady
Coco always gives the best service - always glad whenever we see her because we know we're already getting the best care when visiting Harriet's!
Amazing great service

Sehr enttÃ¤uschender Besuch. Das Personal war unfreundlich und untersagt grundsÃ¤tzlich das Fotografieren der Skyline mit einer Kamera â€“ selbst wenn man nur Bilder von sich selbst machen mÃ¶chte. FÃ¼r die â€gutenâ€œ PlÃ¤tze gilt zudem einâ€¦

Although the food and drinks were ok, this place has its flaws. Iâ€™d been here 3 days ago for a business meeting at 2pm and had no issues. The 2nd time for dinner was the problem. I didnâ€™t know about a minimum spend of $150 (it was $75 during the day and says that on the booking site) until I arrived. The staff was ok but then at the end of the night, we kept getting warnings that they were closing soon at 11. Thatâ€™s normal and I get it. At 10:55, a guy comes and grabs the light off of our table and says â€œsorry guys. Weâ€™re closing in like 2 minutesâ€. We were left sitting in the dark. Then on the receipt, thereâ€™s a big line for tip but in very small print, it says. 20% gratuity is already taken. I had to ask the waitress to confirm this. It wasnâ€™t made clear from at any other point. 2 stars because the view is incredible.

Came to check this place out because I had seen it online and before I could say how many people were in my party or what I was checking out the space for the hostess says â€œjust to let you know itâ€™s a minimum $150 spend per person.â€ I was so confused because why mention money? Iâ€™m clearly there to spend. I told her I was checking it out online and wanted to be seated. Needless to say I declined and went to Manhattan and spent more than $150 there because I wasnâ€™t judged based on my skin color or appearance. Steer clear friends

We had a reservation for two at Harrietâ€™s Rooftop, and unfortunately, the experience did not meet expectations. Upon arrival, no one greeted us at the entrance, and we had to wait around 15 minutes before the host showed up. When she finally arrived, she was extremely arrogant and dismissive. We mentioned that we were celebrating my birthday and asked if it would be possible to sit by the window. She told us that those tables were reserved for groups of four, yet later in the evening we saw two separate tables by the window with only two guests each. This felt dishonest and left a very negative impression.

We also ordered a cake, and since we had informed them it was my birthday, we naturally expected at least a small gesture, such as a candle. Shockingly, there was nothing â€” and my brother had to remind the staff twice before we finally received a candle. For a restaurant of this category, where guests celebrate special occasions, this lack of attention is simply unacceptable.

Although our waitress was kind and attentive, the food was mediocre and the drinks were just average â€” nothing special. For a place with a minimum spend of $150 per person, one would expect much higher standards both in service and in quality. We spent around $350 in total, but the overall experience was far from worth it.

In summary, apart from the nice view and the polite waitress, there was little to justify the high prices or the minimum spend. Service, honesty, and food quality fell short of expectations. Sadly, I cannot recommend Harrietâ€™s Rooftop and would only rate it 2 out of 5 stars.
The service is terrible.

I honestly canâ€™t get enough of this place. Every pool season tops the last. But Marto! Marto was just nothing short of amazing. The attentiveness made my entire day. Harrietâ€™s never disappoints. Get more Martoâ€™s!!!!

Food, drinks and views are all phenomenal but the service by Taija takes the cake. She was attentive, offered great suggestions and made our experience unforgettable. I live in LA but come to NY often! Canâ€™t wait to come back and dine again at Harrietâ€™s!

We had a rooftop table reserved for sunset drinks, but about an hour before our reservation a heavy rainstorm started. It made little sense to sit on a rooftop in the pouring rain, and getting there on time became impossible.

We called the venue three times before our reservation to cancel, but no one ever picked up. On the last attempt, we left a voicemail explaining the situation. Despite this, at 19:10 we noticed a $50 â€œmissed reservationâ€ fee charged to our card, even though our booking was for 19:30.

Since then, Iâ€™ve tried reaching out several times by phone and email, but have received no response.

Be cautious booking here. If it rains, you may find yourself forced to either sit on the rooftop in bad weather or risk being charged a fee for not showing up, even after trying to cancel in advance.

Had an event here and stayed at the hotel. The rooftop bar and pool are beautiful, with absolutely stunning views. The food was fantastic and the staff attentive. The pool lounge area is on the smaller side, but thatâ€™s standard for this area as it's hard to even find an outdoor pool. Overall, a wonderful experienceâ€”Iâ€™ll definitely be back!

Rooms are all brand new and updated with filtered water tap in the room! They are small but also standard for the area.  Very clean and the room feel larger with the huge windows.  Amazing views for the upgraded room.

Hotel staff was so accommodating and helpful.  They also have a courtesy car to take you around.  Great location near so many great places. Highly recommend, just pricey but standard for the area.

Absolutely loved our experience at Harrietâ€™s Rooftop in Brooklyn! âœ¨ Zen was so accommodating and made our day extra special. The view? Ultra amazing! Truly one of the best in the city. The food and drinks were just as impressive. Every penny was 100% worth it. Canâ€™t wait to go back!

Everything was amazing! Food was delicious, service was wonderful. Alejandro and Zen gave us a very warm welcome. At the rooftop Camilo was really helpful and Jose is really kind, at the swimming pool he's everywhere at anytime helping you. The entire experience was excellent, they made it possible. Thank you! â¤ï¸ I loved it ğŸ˜

I visited Harrietâ€™s Rooftop and absolutely loved it! The atmosphere is amazing â€” with beautiful views of Manhattan, a cozy setting, and stylish decor. The food was delicious . The staff was polite and attentive. Itâ€™s a perfect spot to enjoy an evening with friends or celebrate a special occasion. I will definitely come back again!

I had a disappointing experience at Harrietâ€™s while hosting a farewell for a friend. We had a reservation for 8 and we were prepared to meet the min spend requirement ($75pp).
The issue arose when two friends stopped by briefly with their baby to say goodbye, something I had proactively cleared with the hostess. However, when the parents sat with us at the existing table, the server announced they would be added to the minimum spend.

I explained that I had already cleared it with the hostess downstairs. We would have been open to alternatives that met us halfway; instead, she then doubled down, claiming that since they had ordered a drink, they would be added to the minimum spend of $150/person (as it was after 4 pm). We were put in the uncomfortable position of asking the parents to leave with their baby shortly after they arrived, which felt unnecessarily cold and harsh.

At one point, our server made a snide remark when we wanted to order some snacks, and towards the end, we were given a countdown to meet our spend, even though the venue was mostly empty (photo attached).

It was clear the venue was singularly focused on making money. I understand policies exist, but there was a clear lack of empathy, especially toward parents with a baby and a group celebrating a special occasion. A bit of discretion would have gone a long way. I had originally wanted to raise these points privately, and I sent the venue and the GM emails and called the venue directly. Alas, only for my outreach to be completely ignored.

Absolutely worth it for the views alone â€” unbeatable skyline and sunset scenes over Manhattan. Drinks were solid, vibes were upscale and lively. Atmosphere great especially with an event on. Great spot for a special night out.

Absolutely incredible views of the water and Statue of Liberty and especially Brooklyn bridge. The service was amazing the staff was so nice and attentive. They checked up on us multiple times! The food was soooo good. I loved the watermelon frozen margarita. I had a wonderful time

Absolutely worth it for the stunning view!
If youâ€™re planning to sit at a table, keep in mind thereâ€™s a $150 minimum spend per person. But if youâ€™re just there for a drink, you can order at the bar and grab any open spot - itâ€™s first come, first serve. Also good to know: tips for cocktails are already included.
Definitely a must-visit spot!
Ã‡ok kÃ¶tÃ¼ kokteyl, orta sÄ±nÄ±f yemekler ve yÃ¼ksek Ã¼cretler. KiÅŸi baÅŸÄ± 150 USD harcama sÄ±nÄ±rÄ± ive kÄ±sÄ±tlÄ± oturma sÃ¼resi cidden bu mekana Ã¶denen Ã¼cret iÃ§in piÅŸman etmektedir.

We have been here before and always recommend this rooftop to friends. But this time the service was very slow, mediocre food. The view is AMAZING and I thinks itâ€™s worth the 75$ charge per person. Still would have liked to say the food and drinks matched the ambience.

The food and drinks were very good the only problem was Rocko. He was very rude and rushed us to get out. He first came at around 10:15 pm saying theyâ€™re closing and we have to get out even though we were still having our food and drinks.
Such a beautiful experience ğŸ¤ŒğŸ»ğŸ¤ŒğŸ».The views of the iconic Brooklyn Bridge, and the Manhattan skyline are just amazing. The food is Ok!! And please do reserve a table ahead!!

Je suis allÃ© au Harrietâ€™s Rooftop Brooklyn avec des attentes Ã©levÃ©es aprÃ¨s avoir suivi leur page Instagram pendant des mois. Mais malheureusement, mon expÃ©rience a Ã©tÃ© trÃ¨s dÃ©cevante. Lorsque je me suis prÃ©sentÃ© un samedi Ã  18h pour boire un verre et profiter de la vue, j'ai Ã©tÃ© surpris de dÃ©couvrir un ticket d'entrÃ©e de 100 dollars par personne sans aucune consommation incluse. Cela m'a semblÃ© excessif sous prÃ©texte quâ€™il y a un Ã©vÃ¨nement . AprÃ¨s avoir fait demi-tour, je suis revenu le lendemain dimanche par curiositÃ©, mais la surprise a Ã©tÃ© encore plus grande. La vue Ã©tait moins belle que ce que j'avais imaginÃ©, et l'Ã©tablissement Ã©tait mal entretenu. Les photos sur Instagram et Google ne reflÃ©taient pas du tout la rÃ©alitÃ©. Les banquettes et le bois du bar Ã©taient anciens, secs et grisÃ¢tres, sans aucun vernis ni entretien. J'ai Ã©tÃ© trÃ¨s dÃ©Ã§u et j'ai dÃ©cidÃ© de partir immÃ©diatement pour aller dans un Ã©tablissement voisin qui offrait une meilleure vue, un meilleur service et un matÃ©riel de qualitÃ©.

The hotel exceeded all expectations, but Harriettâ€™s was the unexpected highlight. Sophisticated cocktails, stunning views, and bartenders with a rare talent for making guests feel truly looked after. I recently dined at this restaurant and was truly blown away by the entire experience. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted warmly by the hosts. The ambiance was fantastic, but it was the view that truly stole the show â€“ absolutely amazing.

I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a memorable dining experience. The combination of amazing food, a stunning view, and top-notch service make it a must-visit destination. We'll definitely be returning soon!

Beautiful rooftop views of the Manhattan skyline and Brooklyn Bridge. But the drinks are pricey and not good. All three drinks we ordered were unbalanced and took the bartender a while to make even though it was empty.

Este lugar se dedica a estafar gente.

Cuando haces la reserva te dicen que el consumo minimo es de 150USD, te traen la cuenta con el monto que consumiste y te piden la tarjeta. A la hora de autorizar el pago, te suman todo lo que no hayas consumido pero lo peor es que los 150 usd son POR PERSONA y eso no lo aclaran.

Sumado a eso, el servicio es malo, la comida no es buena, las bebidas te las dan en vaso/copa de plastico. En una noche despejada no son capaces de correr las sombrillas para tener una vista despejada.

El lugar es realmente desastroso, lo unico que vale la pena es la vista (siempre y cuando te toque en una buena ubicacion). No recomiendo a nadie cenar en este lugar, es tan malo que te arruinan la noche o incluso las vacaciones.

Have a mixed reaction writing this review as our initial experience was terrible but then it got better.
Not sure if it was a miscommunication thing or what but originally we were told that the rooftop has no seatings and just a place to go up and enjoy the view. Was told the only way to enjoy the view was to get a table with a minimum bill of $75 / person. We were a party of 4. We decided to get the last walk in table even thought we clearly said weâ€™re here just for drinks.
Got to the table which was mediocre and hot. Waited and waited and no service. The host that took us to the table said we could bring our drinks to the rooftop. After long wait, went back to the reception and this time they said we canâ€™t take our drinks to the rooftop and that actually thereâ€™s a bar on the roof; just no food. Itâ€™s first come first serve.

We luckily was able to give up our table and went to the rooftop which was what we originally came here for. Found lots of available seatings to enjoy the spectacular view of NYC. Even had a nice bar with super friendly bartenders serving nice drinks. Vibe and decor was excellent with good beats playing. Ended up with a bar tab of $260 for about 11 drinks which was costly but then well worth it with the view. Bartender clearly said gratuity 20% was already included.

Suggest the hotel to have better instructions for the restaurant reception on how to welcome guest. Donâ€™t try to trick them in having to get a table. Either have the rooftop bar open to the public or make it as hotel guest only area.
